Must share your opinion many Thanks It is about time they allowed cryptocurrency advertisements. They didn't allow it before because of the government's stance on cryptocurrency and how it could affect their business if the government decides to take action against them for allowing its advertisement. Following the SEC's approval of the spot bitcoin ETF, many big companies that previously refused to allow the use of cryptocurrency will reconsider because they will have the backing of the SEC, which has already accepted and approved the asset to be traded. Overall, this is for their own benefit because bitcoin already achieved more over the years and its penetration into the world of digital technology is already felt globally.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Google knows what they are doing when they openly allowed cryptocurrencies and related services to be advertised on their platform. Since the floodgates of ETFs were opened just a few weeks ago, they don't want to miss on the profits that these giants may give them through buying ad spaces on their search engine. It's a no brainer for them to allow these and scrap their old policy for money. As a giant advertising service, who wouldn't want to tap on that potential profits?

comments.author: Julien_Olynpic
comments.body: Based on Wyckoff's theory, such events usually mark the distribution stage. The spot ETF itself has become an expression of a "sell on the news" event, and Google's permissions to advertise the cryptocurrency in January 2024 means creating liquidity for such sales. Indeed, how will Grayscale sell its bitcoins if there is no liquidity in the market? And how will there be liquidity in the market in sufficient quantities if bitcoin is not advertised to the general investor public? After halving, quite a large portion of miners should go bankrupt and this could trigger short-term panic selling. This is likely to be the next stage according to Wyckoff - market movement after distribution.
